body_html:
@abhigoku10 Until the 01/26/2018 nighty built version, the tensorflow still does NOT support cuda 9.1, but only cuda 9.0. Just see another nighty built version 02/15/2018; not know whether that supports.

If it doesn't work, just use cuda 9.0, and you need to re-set your default cuda path to the 9.0 instead of the 9.1 in your environmental variable settings.

body:
@abhigoku10 Until the 01/26/2018 nighty built version, the tensorflow still does NOT support cuda 9.1, but only cuda 9.0. Just see another nighty built version 02/15/2018; not know whether that supports.

If it doesn't work, just use cuda 9.0, and you need to re-set your default cuda path to the 9.0 instead of the 9.1 in your environmental variable settings.
